oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Interview - Rodney and Doug Dillard with John McEuen - 2006-09-29
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Interview with Doug and Rodney Dillard and John McEuen from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on September 29, 2006. Interview follows a screening of the film A Night In the Ozarks.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Doug Dillard; Rodney Dillard; John McEuen;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Interview moderated by Jay Orr. Includes off-mic questions from the audience. Recording begins in progress (00:00) Comments on the just screened film A Night In The Ozarks including the house shown in the film, the helicopter shot and on-set security / (03:38) Difficulty of seeing their parents in the film / (05:07) Musical and vocal influences / (05:49) Question about the band getting back together for the film / (06:47) Talk about the history of the group and being the second generation of bluegrass musicians / (09:01) Story about packing up and heading to Hollywood / (10:58) Talk about the first album titled The Dillard Brothers / (12:13) Plays recording of Highway Of Sorrows from the Dilliard Brothers album / (14:27) Personnel that made the album / (14:57) Why the Dillards went to California and not Nashville / (16:54) Talk about the Dillard, Clark, Hillman record and talk about the Nitty Gritty Dirt Band making the Circle album /

(18:46) Louise Scruggs influence on the Circle album and mention of fiddler Vassar Clements and Uncle Pen / (20:25) John McEuen on Vassar Clements / (21:04) Rodney on Vassar Clements / (23:41) Doug with comments about how they signed with the Elektra record label in California and Andy Griffith hearing them / (25:59) More on the Andy Griffith show / (27:36) Questions from the audience / (27:54) McEuen with why Super 8 film was used for the film / (29:09) Rodney talks about how he met Dean Webb and Mitch Layne / (30:55) Being part of eclectic touring acts / (31:53) McEuen on the DVD bonus footage and why the audio sounds so good / (33:18) Where Dean Webb and Mitch Layne are now / (35:03) Question about playing on other projects / (36:26) Question about Dad Dillard written song / (37:48) How do they look at what they did and current music now / (38:36) McEuen comments on making art and recording Carolina Traveler with Earl Scruggs /
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Dillard, Douglas Flint, 1937-2012; Dillard, Rodney; McEuen, John, 1945-; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
